content.description: Stand start on sloper sich.  Left hand to crimp rail.  Match hands and to the top
content.location: The fit boulder on the left side.

content.description: Start on Cue Ball and do a big move up and right to a crimp pocket at the lip. Continue climbing rightward via slopers and crimps to finish on the slab between Cue Ball and Boysize. Sandy slopers and a jug await!
content.location: Shares start with Cue Ball. Go right!

content.description:
Crawl into the Turtle's Mouth in the parking lot for Boysize Area.  Exit the brainstem on the other side using toe cams, elbow scums, kneebars and basically any means necessary.  A cinch for the slender and high vomit potential for most.  Not recommended for the claustrophobic.

Tucker Ronzoni is believed to have claimed the first dog ascent in Spring of 2013.
content.location: Boy Size area parking lot.

content.description:
Start standing on big holds, and head straight up. There are not many very easy problems at Joe's that are actually fun. I think this one, as well as Tonka (to the right of Toy Truck) qualifies.

Run up it tennies if you're passing through. Or you can actually get your climbing shoes on, and do all the easy ones in this area, starting with these two, for a nice circuit.
content.location: Backside of the Boysize boulder. Look for two independent lines of very large holds with a slightly undercut face below.

content.description: Along with Toy Truck, Tonka is a member of that rare breed of easy, fun climb in the Valley. Start standing on good holds, and head straight up.
content.protection: Rack to 4" with doubles in 1/2" to 3". Offset Aliens, Lost Arrows, Angles. Two sets of nuts is nice. Also, a couple of stakes or blades for protecting the long snow pitches. Bring webbing, and make sure to have two lines with you for the descent. Just kidding! You only need one pad.
content.location: Right of Toy Truck, on the backside of the Boysize boulder. There will be two lines that start on good holds at head height, and go straight up. It looks, for a moment, like there is a line in the center of the two, and you could probably force one, but it makes more sense to do this as two separate lines.

content.description:
AKA: Crouger

Standing start on the slab to the right of Footmare. Follows the very shallow pockets and micro edges to the top.
content.location: Boysize area, Footmare boulder, in between Footmare and Freddy. Find Footmare's well chalked undercling and Crougar starts on the slab to right of it.

content.description: Start on mini jug and sidepull on the backside of the golden plates boulder. Goes straight up to the top of the boulder. Powerful start with long top out. Fun but sharp.
content.location: Go around the side of the golden plates and look at the slabbier face that faces the boysize boulder.

content.description: Start matched on a sloper dish.  Left hand to the incut edge and climb straight up the face to the jug at the lip.
content.location: The Fit boulder

content.description: Stand start match on ok pocket, big move up then work right near the top on pockets, finish/mantel on v7 the fit.
content.location: Starts on the left side of the fit boulder, same face as the fit v7

content.description: Begin right of the tree and climb straight up on sharp but good holds. Worth doing if you're in the area.
content.location: On the Fit Boulder (uphill from Golden Plates and Boy Size) just to the left of The Fit.

content.description: sit start lower left side arete using a jugish hold and good sidepull, one hard move gets you to good holds then traveres right to dihedral-ish feature, climb up to top.    (if you stand start it goes at v1-2)
content.location: if standing and facing boysize v7, turn around and you'll see the face.

content.description: Sit start on the big flakes on the corner of the Footmare boulder. Follow the razor sharp flakes to an easy top out.
content.location: Located to the left of Elm Street on the corner of the Footmare boulder.

content.description: Up the hill from "Boysize" is a fairly large boulder with two obvious lines on it.  "Mono E Mono" takes the right of the two lines starting with your left hand in a mono and your right hand on an edge.  Move more or less straight up and move right for an easy topout or stay direct for some added spice.

Begin in the big undercling huecos and crimp hard on bad slopey edges, reaching desperately to a decent hold for your right hand. Go roughly straight up to better holds at the lip. This line is beautiful.
content.protection: Pads and a spot, the landing slopes away to the right a bit.
content.location: Uphill from Boy Size, on the Golden Plates Boulder just to the left of Mono E Mono.

content.description: Stand start at the well chalked undercling on the Footmare boulder. Follows the shallow pockets.
content.location: Boysize area, footmare boulder, in between Elm Street and Crougar.

content.description: This short problem can feel simple or impossible, depending on your finger size and crimp power. Pull on to a thin but positive right sidepull and a nasty left crimp around 7 feet up and power to good edges at the lip.
content.location: Find this boulder by walking up the hill between the Boy Size and Golden Plates boulders. This problem is on the right side of the wall that faces the wash.

content.description: Start inside the small cave on a jug rail and come out and left to top out.
content.protection: A pad and a friend to keep the bush from snaging your shirt.
content.location: The small cave boulder next to chex mix

content.description: Start as for Boysize.  Traverse right to the jug then up.
content.location: Boysize boulder

content.description:
On the Footmare boulder between Nightmare and Footmare.

Start with hands matched on the big flake, and follow the jugs up to the top.
content.location: Boysize Area, Footmare boulder, between Nightmare and Footmare

content.description: sit start on opposing sidepull jugs, big move left to pocket then go up to crimps, techy mantel
content.location: left of boysize v7 on the same boulder, next to pine tree.

content.description: Sit start right side on good rail, move up and left on good holds to top.
content.location: from nightmare on elm street, go up hill to neighboring boulder. (very featured looking)

content.description: Start on jug rail inside cave and go strait up the face. It will take some creativity to find the feet.
content.location: Small cave boulder right of chex mix

content.description: The Boysize boulder is fairly small with several obvious lines decorating the west face.  "Boysize" begins sitting with both hands in a right facing jug.  From there, move up on horrible, greasy holds and don't feel too bad when you pop off and bust your ass.
Start in the cave on the jug rail and traverse right.
content.location: Small cave boulder right of chex mix.
